text.p: The following are the stories reported in Lithuanian newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The election comission ruled the election results in Salcininkai region null and void on discovery that the Liberal party supporters paid for votes.

- The final local election results showed that the rulling Homeland Union party won 33.22 percent of seats in the municipalities, Democratic Labour party - 14.29 percent and the Christian Democrats 12.13 percent.
- The state-run oil prospecting company Geonafta had 10.1 million litas profit in 1996 versus 5.8 million litas a year before. The company is on the government's list for privatisation in open bids.
- Economy Minister Vincas Babilius plans to visit Moscow this week to negotiate with Russia's LUKoil and Jukos over potential investments into Butinge oil terminal.
- Statistics department preliminary figures show that GDP rose by 3.6 parcent in 1996 versus three percent a year before and was 31.1 billion litas.

- Hermis bank, which reported 27.4 million litas net profit in 1996 versus 9.6 million litas losses a year before, eyes the State Commercial bank which was earmarked for privatisation by the country's government.
- The only micro-surgery centre in the country in Vilnius University clinics annualy carries out some 1,500 operations.
- The newspaper publishes an article about the KGB influence in the bankrupt Aurabank.
